channel.title: Making my server 459?
channel.description:
Well, i dont know if there is a tutorial or anything for it but i want to make a server wich uses the same new interfaces as the current RuneScape.
But i realy dont know how to make that. Any1 got any clue what to do and would any1 be so kindly to explain it to me or quickly tell me what to search for /edit?

item.title: Making my server 459?
item.dc:creator: @J03RY J03RY
item.description:
@J03RY wrote:

Speljohan:

get popcorn89’s deobfuscator from moparisthebest.com, just run it and it will automatically download and deobfuscate the latest runescape release for you.

Okay, thanks i will try that.

Read full topic

item.title: Making my server 459?
item.dc:creator: @J03RY J03RY
item.description:
@J03RY wrote:

MMcgrady1:

First off, to make a 459 server, go to your server source, delete everything and then start by scratch, look at the client deob which can be found in the world page by editing the ip and then pasting it in a browser. Deobfuscate and decompile the client and look at the login packets, then start with your empty source and make a 459 server.

Well i was planning to start off from scratch.
But ehm, could you give a little bit more information or explanation about the deobfuscating and decompiling from the client?
And what client should i decompile? where should i get that client?

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic

item.title: Making my server 459?
item.dc:creator: @MMcgrady1 MMcgrady1
item.description:
@MMcgrady1 wrote:

First off, to make a 459 server, go to your server source, delete everything and then start by scratch, look at the client deob which can be found in the world page by editing the ip and then pasting it in a browser. Deobfuscate and decompile the client and look at the login packets, then start with your empty source and make a 459 server.

item.title: Making my server 459?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

… you can’t edit it. The packet structure in the latest runescape release is completely different. You would have to design a server completely from scratch in order to achieve this.

Read full topic

omg, this sucks.

item.title: Making my server 459?
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

Step 1:

RuneScape

RuneScape - Free Fantasy MMORPG Browser Game

A free browser based MMORPG game updated with fresh content each month. Set in a medieval fantasy realm; experience story-driven quests, master skills and make new friends.


Step 2:
Start Menu
Step 3:
Run
Step 4:
.jagex_cache_32
Step 5:
There’s your cache files in one of the folders, I’ll leave for you to find out which folder.
